text: 2015 continued a terrible recent period
for airline accidents in January in Tae
Yong a plane crashed into a river
killing 48 of the 58 people on board two
months later a Germanwings flight from
Barcelona crashed into the Alps killing
150 people and all this after 2014 the
deadliest year in aviation for over a
decade with over a thousand fatalities I
think the public is wondering how safe
flying is as that year was coming to an
end one particular tragedy shocked the
world fear definitely fear thunderstorms
can literally tear an airplane apart on
December 28 2014 and AirAsia flight to
Singapore suddenly disappeared from
radar screens 162 people are feared dead
after an AirAsia flight goes missing as
the search began there was one question
on everyone's mind we're gonna know what
happened we have to know what caused it
we pieced together what's known of the
flights final minutes world-class
experts explore the troubling questions
raised by the tragedy and reveal that
many of us today fly at an altitude that
pilots call coffin corner we prefer to
the airplane as being in coffin corner
because if you go any slower you'll lose
control of the aircraft
we examine the disturbing similarity to
the Air France crash of 2009 showing
what can go wrong when pilots rely too
heavily on their computers pilots today
have lost their skills and with up to
two million people in our skies at every
moment we investigate the technology
designed to protect the fliers of the
future we have to overcome sitter
weather conditions until that technology
arrives just how safe will your next
flight be the shocking truth is that an
AirAsia type event could happen anywhere
in the world today
